para.text: General Quick Dialog is the most general form of the quick dialogs. This is used for most of the elements. This appears when an element is double-clicked in diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Element visibility can be selected from
Element name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Subsystem Quick Dialog is applied only to subsystem elements. This appears when a subsystem is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Subsystem visibility can be selected from
Subsystem name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

Element visibility can be selected from
Element name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

Class, Interface, Signal, Exception, Actor, UseCase, Artifact

Attribute Quick Dialog is applied only to attribute elements. This appears when an attribute is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Attribute visibility can be selected from
Attribute stereotype, visibility, name, type, multiplicity, order and default value can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

li.text: Quick Dialog doesn't supports a part of [multiplicity ordered] among attribute notations in UML Specification. Because it has been used part of type as [] symbol to the meaning of array.

para.text: This adds a new attribute in the next location. Hitting
has the same effect. To insert in the current location, hit the
This moves the current attribute up. Hitting
has the same effect. To edit the upper attribute, just hit the
This moves the current attribute down. Hitting
has the same effect. To edit the lower attribute, just hit the
Operation Quick Dialog is applied only to operation elements. This appears when an operation is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Operation visibility can be selected from
Operation stereotype, visibility, name, parameter, and return type can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : Enter the stereotype name. This may be omitted.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : Enter the character that corresponds to the operation’s visibility (‘+’: public, ‘#’: protected, ‘-’: private, ‘~’: package). This may be omitted.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : Enter the operation’s parameters. Parameters follow the syntax of “

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: ” and the parameters are separated by comma (,). Parameter relay direction is indicated by ‘direction’; it can be ‘in’, ‘inout’, or ‘out’. Parameter name is indicated by ‘name’, and parameter type is indicated by ‘type’. This may be omitted.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : Enter the operation’s return type. This may be omitted.

para.text: This adds a new operation in the next location. Hitting
has the same effect. To insert in the current location, hit the
This moves the current operation up. Hitting
has the same effect. To edit the upper operation, just hit the
This moves the current operation down. Hitting
has the same effect. To edit the lower operation, just hit the
Literal Quick Dialog is applied only to literal elements. This appears when a literal is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Literal visibility can be selected from
Literal name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

AssociationEnd Quick Dialog is applied only to AssociationEnd elements. This appears when an association is double-clicked at the end in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
AssociationEnd aggregation can be selected from
Composition Navigability can be configured by checking.
AssociationEnd visibility can be selected from
AssociationEnd name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

para.text: AssociationEnd’s multiplicity can be selected from 0..1, 1, 0..*, 1..*, and * or entered directly.
ClassifierRole Quick Dialog is applied only to ClassifierRole elements. This appears when a Classifier is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
ClassifierRole visibility can be selected from
ClassifierRole name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

para.text: This creates a new class element in the parent namespace of the collaboration where the ClassifierRole element belongs, and references the new class element in the ClassifierRole’s base attribute.
Object Quick Dialog is applied only to object elements. This appears when an object is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
Object visibility can be selected from
Object stereotype, visibility, name and type can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

li.text: : Enter the character that corresponds to the object’s visibility (‘+’: public, ‘#’: protected, ‘-’: private, ‘~’: package). This may be omitted.

li.text: : Enter the object’s type name. This has to be one of the classifiers defined in the current project. This may be omitted.

para.text: This creates a new class element in the parent namespace of the CollaborationInstanceSet where the object element belongs, and references the new class element in the object’s classifier attribute.
Message/Stimulus Quick Dialog is applied only to message and stimulus elements. This appears when a message or a stimulus is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.

This connects specific elements according to the message or stimulus type. If the message or stimulus has CallAction, one of the operations of the object on the other end can be selected. If it is a CreateAction, it can connect a Classifier. If it is a SendAction, it can connect a Signal element.
Message or stimulus visibility can be selected from
Message or stimulus name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: : Enter the expression for the arguments passed to the message or stimulus. This may be omitted.

para.text: The sequence number, which indicates the execution order of the message or stimulus, can be changed.
If the message or stimulus has a CallAction, this button creates a new operation in the other object, and references the new operation in the CallAction’s operation attribute.
State Quick Dialog is applied only to state elements (CompositeState and SubmachineState). Hitting the
key or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
State visibility can be selected from
State name, visibility and stereotype can be entered in the edit field according to the syntax.

Note/Text Quick Dialog is applied only to note elements and text elements. This appears when a note or text element is double-clicked in a diagram. Hitting
or clicking outside the quick dialog applies the changes.
The edit field can contain any contents.
